gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਰੈਨਿ ਸਮੈ ਸਬ ਲੋਗ ਮੈ ਸੰਜੋਗ ਭੋਗ ਚਕੲੀ ਬਿਓਗ ਸੋਗ ਭਾਗ ਹੀਨੁ ਜਾਨੀਅੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Raini Samai Sab Log Mai Sanjog Bhoga , Chakaee Biaog Sog Bhaag Heenu Jaaneeai ?
translation: Just as everyone enjoys the company of their dear ones at night, but a ruddy sheldrake is considered unfortunate having been separated from its beloved.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਦਿਨਕਰਿ ਕੈ ੳੁਦੋਤਿ ਜੋਤਿ ਜਗਮਗ ੳੁਲੂ ਅੰਧ ਕੰਧ ਪਰਚੀਨ ੳੁਨਮਾਨੀਅੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Dinakari Kai Udoti Joti Jagamaga , Uloo Andh Kandh Paracheen Ounamaaneeai ?
translation: Just as sunrise brightens up the place but an owl is seen hidden in dark allays and walls.

gurmukhi: ਸਰਵਰ ਸਰਿਤਾ ਸਮੁੰਦ੍ਰ ਜਲ ਪੂਰਨ ਹੈ ਤ੍ਰਿਖਾਵੰਤ ਚਾਤ੍ਰਕ ਰਹਤ ਬਕ ਬਾਨੀਅੈ
transliteration: Saravar Saritaa Samoundr Jal Pooran Hai , Trikhaavant Chaatrak Rahat Bak Baaneeai ?
translation: Ponds, streams and oceans are seen to be full to the brim with water, but longing for rain, a rain-bird remains thirsty and keeps wailing and crying for that Swati drop.

gurmukhi: ਤੈਸੇ ਮਿਲਿ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਿ ਸਕਲ ਸੰਸਾਰ ਤਰਿਓ ਮੋਹਿ ਅਪਰਾਧੀ ਅਪਰਾਧਨੁ ਬਿਹਾਨੀਅੈ ॥੫੦੯॥
transliteration: Taisay Mili Saadhasangi Sakal Sansaar Tariao , Mohi Aparaadhee Aparaadhanu Bihaaneeai ?509?
translation: Similarly by associating themselves with the congregation of the True Guru, the whole world is sailing across the worldly ocean but I, the sinner is spending all his life in evil deeds and vices.  (509)
